basics.name: Mohsin Khan
basics.label: PhD Researcher in Cybersecurity
basics.summary: Cybersecurity researcher specializing in lightweight cryptography, blockchain-based access control, and secure embedded systems. Experienced in academic and industrial security projects with a focus on IoT and distributed trust architectures.

location.address: Department of Computer Science, UiT The Arctic University of Norway

work.name: Blackbuck Insight
work.summary: Migrated and processed big datasets from on-premises infrastructure to AWS cloud for TransUnion, improving data accessibility and reducing query latency by 40%.
highlights: Worked with MapReduce, HDFS, PySpark, Apache, Python, and Linux.
Used AWS services including S3, EC2, EMR, and Lambda.
Improved data pipeline performance and security during migration.

volunteer.summary: Assisted in the organization and coordination of the IEEE CCGRID 2025 Conference hosted at UiT.
highlights: Supported session management and technical logistics.
Engaged with participants and managed venue arrangements.

volunteer.location: UiT The Arctic University of Norway
volunteer.summary: Organized internal PhD seminars to facilitate knowledge exchange among doctoral researchers.
highlights: Managed announcements and follow-ups with participants.

education.institution: UiT The Arctic University of Norway
courses: Science, Technology and Society (Digital Life Norway)

education.title: Impact of Management Information Systems (MIS) on Banking Efficiency
Traffic Jam Minimization and Accident Avoidance System using IoT

awards.title: Best Paper Award
awards.awarder: National Conference on Recent Advances in Computer Science and IT (NCRACIT)
awards.summary: Awarded for the paper 'Smart n Secure Home using IoT' presented at NCRACIT, recognizing innovation in embedded and IoT systems for home automation.

awards.title: Certificate of Appreciation
awards.summary: Received for exemplary performance in university-level drawing competition.

certifications.name: Amazon Web Services Certified Developer – Associate
Certified Associate Developer for Apache Spark 3.0 – Python
Real-Time Power System Analysis and Smart Grid
Educational Administration, Management and Leadership in School Education

publications.name: A Comparative Analysis of Lightweight Hash Functions Using AVR ATXMega128 and ChipWhisperer
publications.summary: Benchmarked lightweight hash functions using ChipWhisperer and custom E-RANK metric for performance, memory, and energy evaluation on constrained devices.

publications.name: Software Benchmarking of NIST Lightweight Hash Function Finalists on Resource-Constrained AVR Platform via ChipWhisperer
publications.summary: Analyzed NIST finalists for lightweight hashing on AVR devices, evaluated using ChipWhisperer and E-RANK composite metric.

publications.name: Traffic Congestion Reduction and Accident Circumvention System via Incorporation of CAV and VANET
publications.summary: Designed an intelligent transportation model combining CAV and VANET systems for real-time accident avoidance and congestion detection.

references.name: Prof. Håvard Johansen
references.reference: Professor, Department of Computer Science, UiT The Arctic University of Norway. Supervisor for PhD research in cybersecurity, cryptographic benchmarking, and blockchain-based access control.

references.name: Prof. Dag Johansen
references.reference: Professor, Department of Computer Science, UiT The Arctic University of Norway. Co-advisor and collaborator on distributed trust frameworks and secure IoT architectures.

references.name: Dr. Elisavet Kozyri
references.reference: Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science, UiT The Arctic University of Norway. Co-supervisor on PhD project with focus on lightweight cryptography and system security.

projects.name: Distributed Trust Enforcement Architecture (DTEA)
projects.summary: A blockchain-based access control framework for IoT security using PoA and capability tokens.

projects.name: CryptoBench-RPi-Arduino_LWC
projects.summary: Benchmarking lightweight cryptographic primitives on embedded RPi/Arduino systems.
